meanings.sent1: Lack of exercise can weaken your muscles over time.
meanings.sent2: The storm's strong winds can weaken the structure of the house.
meanings.sent3: I told a joke so funny that it made my friend's knees weaken from laughter.
meanings.sent4: The constant stress at work can weaken your resolve like a slow leak in a tire.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the metal out in the rain will weaken it, making it easier to bend.

meanings.definition: To diminish in strength or intensity.
meanings.sent1: Skipping meals can weaken your energy levels throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: The medication may weaken the symptoms of the illness.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to weaken the audience's skepticism with his charm.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's injury weakened his chances of winning the race.
meanings.sent5: The fading sunlight began to weaken, signaling the end of the day.
